Mie Gerobak Enak
Seru! Mie Ayam Terbang Ini Dilempar-lempar Sebelum Disajikan
07 Nov 2019, 03:30 by Pradito Rida Pertana - detikFood


Foto: Pradito Rida Pertana/dok. detikcom

Yogyakarta - Seorang penjual mie ayam punya cara unik saat memasak mie. Ia melakukan atraksi dengan melempar-lempar mie ke udara sebelum menaruhnya ke dalam mangkuk. Seru!Berkat atraksinya warung mie ayam terbang di Jalan Kolonel Sugiyono, Kelurahan Brontokusuman, Kecamatan Mergangsan, Kota Yogyakarta ini ramai dipadati pengunjung. Bahkan, dalam sehari warung mie ayam terbang mampu menjual ratusan porsi.Mampir ke warung mie ayam terbang yang berlokasi di simpang empat Taman Siswa, kami melihat seorang pria bertopi tengah melempar mie yang diambil dari dalam panci. Selanjutnya, dengan menggunakan serok, ia mulai melempar mie di dalam serok setinggi sekitar 1-1,5 meter beberapa kali lalu menaruhnya ke dalam mangkuk.


Foto: Pradito Rida Pertana/dok. detikcom

Tak urung, aksi itu memancing perhatian pengunjung, bahkan tak sedikit yang merekam video hingga mengabadikan momen tersebut. Penasaran dengan rasa mie ayam yang proses memasaknya unik ini, kamipun memesan 1 porsi mie ayam terbang.Dari segi penampilan, mie ayam ini hampir sama dengan mie ayam pada umumnya. Namun, topping sawi dan potongan ayam pada mie ayam tersebut cukup banyak. Masih ditambah lagi 2 buah pangsit goreng di atasnya.Sedangkan ukuran mienya sendiri lebih kecil dengan tekstur lembut dan mulur. Dalam suapan pertama langsung terasa gurih yang agak kuat pada bumbunya.


Foto: Pradito Rida Pertana/dok. detikcom

Pemilik warung mie ayam terbang, Ali Fauzi (53), atau yang biasa dipanggil Cak Uji menjelaskan, bahwa atraksi melempar mie tersebut ia pelajari saat ikut berjualan mie ayam di Cianjur, Jawa Barat pada tahun 1987. Menurutnya, atraksi tersebut sebagai pembeda dengan penjual mie ayam lainnya."Tahun 1987 kan booming mie ayam, dan karena banyak saingannya saat itu (di Cianjur) harus punya ciri khas sendiri . Terus secara otodidak saya mulai latihan, karena saat itu saya belum lincah," katanya saat ditemui di warung mie ayam miliknya, Selasa (5/11/2019) tengah malam.Setelah ikut berjualan mie ayam di Cianjur, pria kelahiran Desa Kembangan, Kecamatan Sekaran, Kabupaten Lamongan, Jawa Timur ini memutuskan untuk membuka usahanya sendiri di Yogyakarta. Hal itu karena Cak Uji telah memiliki modal yang cukup, terlebih ia mendapatkan istri orang Gunungkidul.


Foto: Pradito Rida Pertana/dok. detikcom

Setelah mendapat tempat untuk berjualan, barulah pada tahun 1991 ia membuka warung mie ayamnya sendiri di pinggir Jalan Kolonel Sugiyono. Dengan mengembangkan teknik melempar mie yang ia pelajari di Cianjur, Cak Uji menerapkannya di Yogyakarta."Jadi pas buka di Jogja itu saya sambil latihan juga, pertama yang melempar itu rendah-rendah dulu terus saya kembangkan sampai bisa melempar mie dengan tinggi. Pernah gagal juga itu karena ada yang lewat belakang saya, terus jadi buyar konsentrasinya," katanya.Menurutnya kunci keberhasilan saat melakukan atraksi lempar mie adalah pada kualitas mie yang harus bagus, mie yang digunakan tidak mudah putus meski sudah dalam kondisi matang. Karena itu, untuk menjaga kualitas mienya, Cak Uji memilih untuk membuat mie sendiri.


Foto: Pradito Rida Pertana/dok. detikcom

"Karena itu saya milih membuat mie sendiri. Terus selain perlu keahlian khusus untuk melempar mie, yang perlu diperhatikan itu adalah seroknya, harus pilih yang bagus agar saat mie dilempar tidak ada yang nyantol di serok," ujar pria yang sudah 29 tahun berjualan mie ayam ini."Dan agar konsentrasi terjaga, kalau mau atraksi saya kasih kode ke teman yang membantu saya dengan mengetukkan sumpit ke pinggiran panci sebanyak 2 kali, tek-tek gitu. Tujuannya biar tidak ada yang lewat belakang saya saat melempar mie ke atas," imbuh Cak Uji.Atraksinya saat memasak mie ayam sempat mendapat cibiran dari banyak orang. Pasalnya saat itu banyak penjual mie ayam yang bermunculan di Yogyakarta."Tdak sedikit orang-orang yang mencibir, tapi saya tetap tenang. Karena saya tidak hanya menjual astraksi, tapi rasa juga, karena mie ayam saya ini pakai kuah khusus bukan kuah beningan itu. Terus mie yang saya pakai buatan sendiri jadi bebas formalin," ucapnya.


Foto: Pradito Rida Pertana/dok. detikcom

Alhasil, atraksinya itu menjadi berkah tersendiri bagi pria yang saat ini tinggal di Kelurahan Sorosutan, Kecamatan Umbulharjo, Kota Yogyakarta ini. Terlebih, warung mie ayam miliknya memiliki waktu buka yang berbeda dengan lainnya."Saya milih jualan di Jogja karena istri orang Gunungkidul, dan supaya bisa lebih dekat dengan orang tua. Selain itu, di Jogja kan banyak mahasiswa juga dan kalau malam suka cari makan, karena itu saya bukanya (warung mie ayam) dari jam 6 malam sampai jam 1 pagi," katanya.Cak Uji menambahkan, dalam sehari ia mampu menghabiskan sekitar 25 kilogram mie. Bahkan, dalam sehari ia mampu menjual ratusan porsi. Sedangkan untuk harga satu porsi mie ayam terbang ia banderol Rp 10.000dan untuk minuman Rp 2.000."Untuk hari biasa paling bisa menjual 200-250 porsi, dan kalau malam Minggu itu bisa menjual 300 porsi," katanya.


Foto: Pradito Rida Pertana/dok. detikcom

Salah satu pengunjung, Oni Purnomo (52) mengaku bahwa ia kerap menikmati mie ayam olahan Cak Uji. Bukan tanpa alasan, hal itu karena ia sudah berlangganan mie ayam tersebut sejak tahun 90an."Saya sudah langganan makan di sini sejak saya pacaran sama suami saya. Jadi sudah sekitar 20 tahun saya langganan di sini, dari harganya dulu masih Rp 500 pokoknya," kata Oni.Warga Kelurahan Sorosutan, Kecamatan Umbulharjo, Kota Yogyakarta ini mengaku menjadikan mie ayam terbang sebagai langganannya bukan karena atraksi memasak mie Cak Uji, namun karena rasa mie ayam yang sesuai dengan lidahnya. Mengingat ia bukan pecinta mie ayam dengan rasa manis."Menurut saya rasanya pas di lidah saya sama suami ya, karena kebanyakan mie ayam di Jogja kan manis dan ini lebih ke gurih. Terus dari jaman dulu sampai sekarang rasanya tidak berubah, itu yang bikin saya tetap memilih makan mie ayam di sini," ucapnya.Simak Video "Gibran Maju Pilkada Solo, Kaesang Sibuk Urusi Transisi Bisnis"[Gambas:Video 20detik](adr/odi)

Delicious Noodle Carts
Exciting! These Flying Chicken Noodles are tossed before Serving
Nov 7 2019, 03:30 by Pradito Rida Pertana - detikFood


Photo: Pradito Rida Pertana / doc. detikcom

Yogyakarta - A chicken noodle seller has a unique way to cook noodles. He did the attraction by throwing noodles into the air before putting it into a bowl. Thanks to the attraction of flying chicken noodle stalls on Jalan Colonel Sugiyono, Brontokusuman Village, Mergangsan District, Yogyakarta City is crowded with visitors. In fact, in a day the flying chicken noodle shop is able to sell hundreds of servings. Stopping at the flying chicken noodle shop located at the intersection of Taman Siswa, we saw a man in a hat throwing noodles taken from the pot. Next, using a scoop, he starts tossing the noodles in a scoop as high as about 1-1.5 meters several times then puts it into a bowl.


Photo: Pradito Rida Pertana / doc. detikcom

Inevitably, the action attracted the attention of visitors, not even a few who recorded videos to capture the moment. Intrigued by the taste of this chicken noodle cooking process, we also ordered 1 serving of flying chicken noodles. In terms of appearance, chicken noodles are almost the same as chicken noodles in general. However, mustard topping and chicken pieces on chicken noodles is quite a lot. Still added 2 pieces of fried dumplings on it. While the size of the noodles themselves are smaller with a soft and stretchy texture. In the first mouthful, it feels savory rather strong on the seasoning.


Photo: Pradito Rida Pertana / doc. detikcom

The owner of the flying chicken noodle shop, Ali Fauzi (53), or commonly called Cak Uji, explained that he learned the attraction of throwing noodles while participating in selling chicken noodles in Cianjur, West Java in 1987. According to him, the attraction was a differentiator from the noodle seller "In 1987 there was a boom of chicken noodles, and because many of its competitors at that time (in Cianjur) had to have their own characteristics. Then I self-taught myself. I started training, because at that time I was not agile," he said when met at his chicken noodle shop. , Tuesday (11/5/2019) midnight. After participating in selling chicken noodles in Cianjur, the man who was born in Kembangan Village, Sekaran District, Lamongan Regency, East Java, decided to open his own business in Yogyakarta. That is because Cak Uji has enough capital, moreover he got the wife of a Gunungkidul man.


Photo: Pradito Rida Pertana / doc. detikcom

After getting a place to sell, then in 1991 he opened his own chicken noodle shop on the edge of Col. Sugiyono Street. By developing the technique of throwing noodles that he learned in Cianjur, Cak Uji applied it in Yogyakarta. "So when I opened it in Jogja, I also practiced, first to throw it low and low, I continued to develop until I could throw noodles high. that is because there is something that passes behind me, continues to be dispersed, "he said. According to him, the key to success when doing the noodle throwing attraction is on the quality of the noodles that must be good, the noodles used are not easily broken even though it is in a ripe condition. Therefore, to maintain the quality of the noodles, Cak Uji chose to make its own noodles.


Photo: Pradito Rida Pertana / doc. detikcom

"Because of that, I chose to make my own noodles. Then besides needing special skills to throw noodles, the thing to note is the spoon, it must choose the good ones so that when the noodles are thrown, no one gets stuck in the spoon," said the man who has been selling chicken noodles for 29 years "And so that concentration is maintained, if you want an attraction I give a code to a friend who helps me by tapping chopsticks on the edge of the pot 2 times, tek tek so. The goal is so that no one passes behind me when throwing noodles up," added Cak Uji. The attractions when cooking chicken noodles got scorn from many people. Because at that time many chicken noodle sellers were popping up in Yogyakarta. "Not a few people snickered, but I remained calm. Because I not only sell astractions, but also taste, because my chicken noodles use special soup instead of the clear soup. "Then the noodles I use are homemade, so they are free from formalin," he said.


Photo: Pradito Rida Pertana / doc. detikcom

As a result, the attraction is a blessing for the man who currently lives in Sorosutan Village, Umbulharjo District, Yogyakarta City. Moreover, his chicken noodle shop has a different opening time than others. "I chose to sell in Jogja because of Gunungkidul's wife, and to be closer to my parents. Besides, in Jogja there are also many students and at night I like to find food, that's why I opened it (chicken noodle stall) from 6 pm to 1 am, "he said. The Uji Test added that in a day he was able to spend around 25 kilograms of noodles. In fact, in one day he was able to sell hundreds of servings. As for the price of a serving of flying chicken noodles, he has a tag of Rp 10,000 and Rp 2,000 for drinks. "For a normal day, he can sell 200-250 servings, and on Sunday nights he can sell 300 servings," he said.


Photo: Pradito Rida Pertana / doc. detikcom

One visitor, Oni Purnomo (52) claimed that he often enjoyed Cak Uji processed chicken noodles. Not without reason, it is because he has subscribed to the chicken noodles since the 90s. "I have been subscribed to eat here since I was dating my husband. So I have been subscribed here for about 20 years, from the price it used to be Rp. 500," said Oni. The Sorosutan village resident, Umbulharjo District, Yogyakarta City claimed to make flying chicken noodles as customers not because of the attraction to cook Cak Uji noodles, but because the taste of chicken noodles was in line with his tongue. Considering he is not a lover of chicken noodles with a sweet taste. "In my opinion it feels right on my tongue with my husband, because most of the chicken noodles in Jogja are sweet and this is more tasty. Continuing from the past until now the taste hasn't changed, that's what makes me still choose to eat chicken noodles here, "he said.
